title: Former Playboy model sues to break silence on alleged Trump affair
text: March 20, 2018 / 7:04 PM / in 2 minutes Former Playboy model sues to break silence on alleged Trump affair Reuters Staff 1 Min Read NEW YORK (Reuters) - A former Playboy model who said she had an affair with President Donald Trump filed a lawsuit in California on Tuesday aiming to release her from a legal agreement that requires her not to speak about the matter. Playboy Playmate of the Year Karen McDougal poses at the Playboy Mansion in Beverly Hills in 1998. REUTERS/Files Karen McDougal filed the lawsuit against American Media Inc, publisher of the National Enquirer, which paid her $150,000 in 2016 to keep quiet on the matter, according to a copy of the lawsuit provided to Reuters by her lawyer. Reporting by Nathan Layne in New York; Editing by Will Dunham
